resources.string: Crisper Humidity Guide
Settings
Hello world!

To connect to the Sensordone, select Connect in the main menu. When connected, the measured humidity will automatically update. Press down on one of the pictures to see information on how that type of produce should be stored. Go to the main menu and choose Instructions for more detailed instructions.
High Humidty: (90%RH+)
Appropriate for crisp, leafy greens and most vegetables.

Examples: Asparagus, apples, beets, broccoli, brussel sprouts, cabbage, carrots, cauliflower, celeriac, celery, collards, corn, endive, grapes, kale, leeks, parsley, parsnips, pears, peas, radishes, rhubarb, rutabagas, spinach
Medium Humidty: (75%-90%RH)
Appropriate for thin skinned fruits and vegetables.
Examples: Beans, cucumbers, eggplant, cantaloupe, watermelon, peppers, potatoes, tomatoes
Low Humidty: (<70%RH)
Appropriate for thick skinned, layered produce.
Examples: Garlic, onions

This app will help you adjust your refrigerator’s crisper to a humidity level that will make your produce store longer. The guidelines in this app are based on the following reference (click link for more details)
1. Make sure your crisper doesn’t have any puddles of water in it, if so, dry them with a paper towel.
2. Connect to your Sensordrone from the menu.
3. Place your Sensordrone in the crisper and close the door.
4. Allow the Sensordrone to stabilize with the refrigerator temperature/humidity for 15-25 minutes.
5. Note the temperature and humidity compared to the guidelines.
6. Adjust your crisper setting up or down as needed, and retest (steps 1-5) 4 or more hours later.
